content: Write a sonnet about springtime in the style of William Wordsworth.

Upon the lap of Nature, soft and green,
Where vernal airs their gentle whispers weave,
I wander, lost in contemplation keen,
And mark how Spring her silent spell doth breathe.

The trees, in budding green, their arms upraise,
As if to greet the sun's returning smile;
Each leaf, a tiny harp, its music plays,
In harmony with brooks that babble mild.

The flowers, in colors bright, their heads upturn,
To drink the nectar from the sky so blue;
Each petal, like a verse in Nature's urn,
Speaks of the joy that only Spring can imbue.

O, how I love these moments pure and sweet,
When Earth awakes, and all is fresh and fleet!
